topic: Are we under attack for Outlook or not?
subject: Re: [patchmanagement] Are we under attack for Outlook or not?
email_text_original:
You don't often get email from pcworxla@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
It looks that way, I had this morning a (single) incident with one user opening
an email with what looks altered email contents in Outlook. All local
virus/malware scans came up empty, also on all other hosts here on the same
network that I have been able to scan far as well. Applied the mentioned
patches, but so far have come up empty that would give any clue as to what
exactly happened. 
Before your email, I suspected a problem that looked like the "RopeMaker" 
exploit, but that was back in 2017, with supposedly no occurrence in the wild
back then. 
Very interested to see if anyone else has had some similar weird incidents this
today... 
Ralf
